alert.note: Alert for Clark; Dallas; Hot Spring; Pike (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 11:59PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Clark, southeastern Pike, west central Dallas and southwestern Hot Spring Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1159 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Blevins, or 9 miles northwest of Prescott, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arkadelphia... Gurdon... Amity... Caddo Valley... Okolona... Whelen Springs... Beirne... Gum Springs in Clark County... Halfway... Crater Of Diamonds State Park... Richwoods... DeGray Lake State Park... Delight... Antoine... Billstown... Alpine... Curtis... Point Cedar... Pisgah... Dalark... This includes Interstate 30 between mile markers 53 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
